textboxes.description: You’ve heard whispers about an underground rave, but what you find is far from ordinary. The basement club you enter is filled with a pulsating beat, not from the music, but from a deep, magical hum. A crowd of robed figures dances wildly, their movements unnatural, synchronized to some unseen force. The air is thick with smoke, colored lights flicker over strange symbols painted on the walls. In the center of the room, an altar has been set up, surrounded by candles and intricate glyphs. A group of mages, led by a charismatic figure named Arkar, are preparing for a dangerous ritual—The Solomon Ritual, which is said to summon immense power. But something feels off. This isn’t just a rave; this is an attempt to tap into ancient magic.

choices.text: Approach Arkar and ask about the ritual.
Observe from the shadows, not wanting to draw attention.
Leave immediately and warn the authorities about the ritual.

textboxes.description: You walk up to Arkar, who smiles upon seeing you, clearly aware of your presence. He tells you that they’re attempting to reenact the Solomon ritual, an ancient magic said to allow its caster to control spirits and demons. The ritual is incredibly dangerous, and only those with immense power can survive it. Arkar claims that they’ve perfected the incantations, but you sense his arrogance and uncertainty. Something in his eyes tells you that they might be in over their heads. He offers you a chance to join them, claiming it will elevate your own magical potential. You wonder whether you should risk it.

choices.text: Agree to join the ritual and see if you can control the magic.
Refuse and try to convince him to stop the ritual.
Leave the club immediately before things escalate.

textboxes.description: You stay in the shadows, trying to learn more without being noticed. As you watch, the mages chant in unison, their voices growing louder and more intense. The ritual seems to be working—the symbols on the walls glow brighter, and the ground begins to tremble. You hear a deep, guttural sound coming from beneath the floor. You realize they’ve started to call something powerful, and if they succeed, it could endanger everyone in the room. You need to act quickly, but how?

choices.text: Interrupt the ritual by disrupting their chants.
Try to find the source of the hum and stop it from within.
Run to find help, knowing that the ritual is spiraling out of control.

textboxes.description: You decide to take a leap of faith and join the ritual. As soon as you step into the circle, the air grows heavier, and the floor beneath your feet pulses. You feel the presence of something ancient, a dark energy that seems to flow into you. The power is intoxicating, but you realize too late that you are becoming part of the ritual. The mages’ chants continue, their faces becoming more entranced. A sudden, sharp pain courses through your chest—something is wrong.

choices.text: Attempt to take control of the magic and force it to obey you.
Stop the ritual, even if it means severing your connection to the power.
Flee the circle, risking the wrath of the summoned force.

textboxes.description: You try to reason with Arkar, telling him that the ritual is too dangerous and that they should stop before it’s too late. But Arkar is unyielding, claiming that they are on the verge of unlocking a power unlike any the world has ever seen. The other mages seem lost in their trance, paying you no mind. Arkar becomes defensive, his smile fading into something more sinister. He warns you not to interfere with the ritual, or you’ll regret it. At this point, you realize you might need to stop the ritual by force.

choices.text: Attempt to disrupt the ritual using your own magic.
Try to find a way to disconnect the power source powering the ritual.
Leave, knowing that convincing Arkar is a lost cause.

textboxes.description: You cast a spell to interrupt the ritual, but the energy that Arkar and the others are channeling is overwhelming. The force lashes out at you, knocking you off your feet. For a moment, you feel like your soul is being pulled from your body. The mages continue chanting, but the energy around you is spiraling out of control. You know you need to do something fast before it’s too late.

choices.text: Use all your magical strength to absorb the power and end the ritual.
Try to force the energy back into the ground, even if it means risking your life.
Escape before the ritual fully awakens and takes control.

textboxes.description: You search for the source of the power, finding a large, glowing crystal beneath the altar. It seems to be the conduit for the ritual’s magic. As you touch the crystal, the power surges through you, threatening to overwhelm your senses. The ritual is connected to it, and if you can sever the link, you might be able to stop it. But the mages are growing more agitated, and the energy is starting to twist the fabric of reality itself.

choices.text: Attempt to destroy the crystal and sever the ritual’s connection.
Try to siphon the magic into yourself and take control of it.
Run, knowing that the crystal could be the only thing keeping the ritual in check.

textboxes.description: With all your strength, you manage to sever the ritual’s connection to the crystal, releasing a blast of energy that sends everyone flying. The room shakes as the dark magic dissipates, and the mages collapse in exhaustion. The rave atmosphere fades into silence, and the partygoers begin to awaken from their trance, no longer under the control of the ritual. Arkar, now weakened, thanks you, though you know he’s realized the dangers of their actions. The Solomon ritual is stopped, and the partygoers scatter. You've saved the day, but at what cost?

You siphon some of the power for yourself, taking control of the ritual. While you manage to stop the destruction, the magic now flows through you. The mages retreat, leaving you with the weight of Solomon’s power. You’ve gained great power, but the cost of meddling with such ancient magic may haunt you forever.

The ritual spirals out of control, the power surging in every direction. The mages are consumed by the magic, and the room collapses into chaos. The rave turns into a nightmare as the summoned force breaks free, its power too great to contain. The world around you twists, and you realize too late that you were unable to stop the catastrophe.
